text: Imma homocrossa is a moth of the family Immidae. It is found on Sumatra. The wingspan is about 20 mm. The forewings are dark fuscous with a slender irregular ochreous-yellow fascia from the middle of the costa to near the dorsum about two-thirds but not quite reaching it. The hindwings are dark fuscous, slightly lighter anteriorly.Exotic Microlep. 4: 3 ==References== Category:Immidae Category:Moths described in 1930 Category:Moths of Indonesia Category:Taxa named by Edward Meyrick
title: Imma homocrossa
